name: Counsel, Product & Corporate Legal - Korea
job_description:
Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with 278 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.


 

The Role

As a company, we challenge industry norms by pushing one another to think creatively about complex questions. Our legal team is no exception. We think critically about the range of legal issues our business faces and act in a manner consistent with our dream team and people over process culture, one marked by a bias toward action, collaborative work, candid discussions, by leaning into smart risks and taking ownership of bold decisions.



THE OPPORTUNITY


We are looking for a talented lawyer to join our Product & Corporate Legal team in Seoul, Korea. Asia Pacific (APAC) is one of our fastest growing regions, and in this role for Korea, you will be instrumental in helping our team deliver fast and practical solutions for a wide range of legal issues, from inquiries from regulatory agencies and other types of consumer-related matters to management of legal documents received to ensure that they reach the appropriate teams.  As part of the legal team, you will assist privacy, commercial, government relations, and other areas of Netflix legal, as needed. 



The Legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with our business partners to innovate and find effective and efficient solutions. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, demonstrate great initiative, an effective cross-cultural communicator, and will welcome the opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial organization. We are looking for someone who will also be excited and inspired by the Netflix culture. 


REQUIREMENTS

  • We’re seeking a qualified lawyer with 3~5 years of relevant experience in a law firm and/or in-house. While not required, experience in the internet, technology or media sectors, familiarity with regulatory compliance, relevant legal issues and agreements, would be preferred;
  • Solution-driven mindset and the ability to think practically, work independently with little guidance, but also to use good judgment to escalate issues when needed;
  • Proficiency in both English and Korean, including excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Strong analytical capabilities and sound judgment; 
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills;
  • Ability to understand and work with commercial and legal ambiguity and nuance to find creative and practical solutions;
  • Ability to learn quickly and tackle new subjects outside area of expertise; and
  • Ability to work proactively, independently, collaboratively and reliably under pressure.


 

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.
